alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 27 at 10:45PM PDT until March 29 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM MONDAY TO 3 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 8 to 10 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Central Coast and Santa Barbara County Central Coast. * WHEN...From 3 PM Monday to 3 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning due to the hazardous conditions. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rough surf with mixed northwest swell and southerly wind waves.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Stay off rock jetties, as they can be deadly in such conditions.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast
